page.p: If you are interested in the ASAP project, please subscribe its mailing list. This list is for users and developers. Once you subscribe, you can post comments, ideas and questions about ASAP. They will be answered ASAP. ;-)
Use tracker to submit bug reports, feature request and small code patches.
Download the latest source release: or browse Git repository.

ASAP is based on a development library, which you can easily embed in your program. It's not only a fully portable C library - it's better than that. Since ASAP is written in Ć, it is also available as pure C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, Python, Swift and OpenCL.
The following projects already use ASAP:

ul.li: mmSAP - standalone player for GNU/Linux and Windows with GTK+ user interface
Rockbox - open source firmware for MP3 players
Game Music Gear MX - player for PlayStation Portable
Modizer - player for iPhone, iPod and iPad
Chipamp - bundle of plugins for Winamp
Atari Sounds For The Masses - GUI frontend to asapconv for macOS
Atari POKEY 8-bit Computer Sound on PIC32 - ASAP on a microcontroller
mxPlay - audio player for Atari Falcon
enotracker - POKEY music editor for PC
POKEY2MIDI - converter to MIDI music files
